alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Monona; Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:44PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong winds of 40 to 50 mph will impact portions of western Shelby, southeastern Monona, northwestern Pottawattamie, Harrison, southeastern Burt, southeastern Colfax, northwestern Lancaster, northern Seward, Douglas, Saunders, northwestern Sarpy, Washington, southern Dodge and Butler Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 541 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gust front along a line extending from 2 miles east of Ute to 2 miles southwest of Hooper to 6 miles west of Bellwood. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong winds will reach... Bellwood and Nickerson around 545 PM CDT. Fremont, Cedar Bluffs, Rising City and Inglewood around 555 PM CDT. Dunlap, Surprise and Woodcliff around 600 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these strong winds include Leshara, Colon, Valley, Earling, Ulysses, Yutan, Mead, Staplehurst, Panama, Utica, Ithaca, Seward and Persia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 61 and 97. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 369 and 375. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for west central Iowa...and east central Nebraska. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Iowa...and northeastern and east central Nebraska.
